content:
So I am getting an error message and I have no idea what it means. Can someone give me a hand? Sorry for it being a screenshot, the VM I'm using can't use the clipboard.
Screenshot-from-2020-09-12-12-47-30.png
I am using the most recent Ubuntu server and I am trying to bind my zulip server to localhost (127.0.0.1)
I’m not totally sure what causes this, but in 3.2 we’ll be switching from pylibmc to python-binary-memcached; other users report that this resolves their similar errors.
Did any mention a fix for this issue?

If you want to try this before 3.2 is released, you can install from the 3.x Git branch.

git clone https://github.com/zulip/zulip.git zulip-server-git -b 3.x

and then use zulip-server-git/scripts/setup/install as per the usual steps.

I tried what you suggested but when downloading version 3.2 with git clone https://github.com/zulip/zulip.git zulip-server-git -b 3.2 it gives a 404. If i just do git clone https://github.com/zulip/zulip.git zulip-server-git -b 3.x it just downloads 3.1. Am I doing the command wrong?
Ok not a 404, but it does say "zulip-server-get is already directory". Is this the 3.2 directory?
You need to literally type 3.x, not 3.2. 3.2 is not released yet. 3.x is the Git branch that will become 3.2 in the future.
Like I said, 3.x is the Git branch that will become 3.2 in the future. zulip-server-git (not -get) is an arbitrary directory name that the git clone command creates. See git help clone.

More fun with the server not booting.
Screenshot-from-2020-09-12-13-52-49.png
I don't see how it is an auth fail as I am running as root
It says the error is from memcache so does this mean I am not giving it enough memory?
